data.title: Test sync implementations
data.body:
Added tests to verify classes use both the ISync interface and the Sync attribute and don't forget one or the other when implementing syncable traits.

Fixed some traits that failed the tests.

data.title: Fixed WithBarrel and made it upgradable
data.body:
Fixes #8439.

Additionally makes trait upgradable and damage-normalized.

data.title: Game crashes on startup
data.body:
Hi all,

When I start the game on Mac OS 10.10.4 I just get a spinning wheel and I have to force quit. It was working perfectly before until I downloaded the latest stable release 20150614. I tried to download the latest mono framework and re-install but same issue.

I then deleting the opera content folder and tried but same issue. Anyone else experience this or any ideas how I can solve it?

I can't see an exceptions log file created...

Thanks,
Kerry

data.title: Removed redundant ISync and ITick from Attack* traits
data.body:
`ISync` is implemented by `AttackBase`, so there's no need for other `Attack*` traits that inherit it to implement it again.
`AttackTurreted` inherits `AttackFollow`, which already implements `ITick`.

data.body:
Press b in lobby, like ping "teams", positions, etc...all players see ping on screen.. and we also need anti-spam on it...

data.title: Fix potential NRE in AI BaseBuilder
data.body: Detected by Coverity

data.title: Fix crates dying while not in the world
data.body:
On large maps, it can take the delivery aircraft longer than the crate's
lifetime to reach the paradrop location, so the crate will be destroyed while it's still in the aircraft, leading to an attempt to get a trait from a destroyed object in the Paradrop trait.

This fixes the lifetime logic of crates so that the lifetime will only be increased when the crate is actually in the world. This will probably also better reflect the intention behind the Lifetime property, which I assume was meant to be the time the crate would be on the map available for pickup, rather than the lifetime of the actor itself.

Fixes #8826

data.title: Dropdown menu doesn't scroll to currently selected item
data.body: When a menu item that is not visible without scrolling is selected, the next time menu is clicked, it doesn't scroll to show the selected item. This is annoying when the menu has a long list of items. For example in the map editor.

data.title: Tiberian Sun units don't follow a straight line
data.body: When moving in vertical and horizontal direction, they follow a zick-zack path.

data.title: map scroll on both axis together causes screen shaking
data.body:
When I try to scroll the map in vertical direction using the radar, the screen vibrates while scrolling. Edge scrolling works, this happens only while dragging in radar map. Horizontal scrolling using radar also works.

data.title: There is a gap between dropdown menu items
data.body:
Sometimes I click on the gap between dropdown menu items and the menu closes with no action. I think there shouldn't be any gap between menu item click areas.

Clicking here closes the dropdown menu without selecting 1 or 2:

data.title: make version doesn't work if git is not set as environment variable in Windows
data.body: On Windows, when I use the make command "version", it says unable to locate git. I have git installed and have local git repository. Is there a way to get the path of git.exe in the make script?

data.title: Game crash Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (crate 1256 (not in world))
data.body:
The game crashed with the following exception:
Version: release-20150614

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20150614
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (crate 1256 (not in world))
   bij OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor)
   bij OpenRA.TraitDictionary.Get[T](Actor actor)
   bij OpenRA.Actor.Trait[T]()
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ParaDrop.IsSuitableCell(Actor actorToDrop, CPos p)
   bij OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ParaDrop.Tick(Actor self)
   bij OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__3(TraitPair`1 x)
   bij OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[T](IEnumerable`1 e, Action`1 a, String text)
   bij OpenRA.World.Tick()
   bij OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   bij OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   bij OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   bij OpenRA.Game.Run()
   bij OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   bij OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Implement heightmap-aware bounds clamping.
data.body:
Followup 1 / 2 of #8781.  This does two things:
- Changes the radar code to draw the full map into the backing sprite.  This is one of the final prerequisite steps for scripted map bounds changes, and dramatically simplifies the required sanity checking.
- Implements a heightmap-aware algorithm for clamping map cells to the projected bounds.

There are two easy ways to test this ingame:
- Try ordering units near and beyond the edges of the map, and observe that they now behave properly.
- Enable the terrain grid in the map editor, and compare the cursor cell with the clamped cell (white).

data.title: Unit limit to cap production for AI bots
data.body: Already exists for buildings. Would solve https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6695.

data.title: Hide overlapping parts of RangeCircles
data.body:
Tiberium wars did something really nice with range circles - it hid the intersecting lines.
I think it would be nice if we could do the same. It would definitely reduce visual noise, for one.
Here are some (not too good) examples that Google was nice enough to provide:
![](http://media.moddb.com/images/mods/1/11/10485/screen2.jpg)
![](http://media.moddb.com/images/mods/1/11/10485/NOD2.jpg)
![](http://i.ytimg.com/vi/jbIaikKAP3c/maxresdefault.jpg)

data.body: When a player is still in game, chat should default to team, when enter is pressed. Avoids accidental messages to enemy players.

data.title: Lua should complain when a referenced sound file cannot be found.
data.body:
It took me ~30 minutes to realize that I forgot to add a directory to `mods/ra2/mods.yaml` while creating [ra2/weather](https://github.com/Phrohdoh/OpenRA/tree/ra2%23weather), because Lua wasn't barking at me to tell me that the sound file I referenced could not be found.

We can't exactly get `directory $foo not found` from this, because the directory may be loaded but the file itself may be missing.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25049792-lua-should-complain-when-a-referenced-sound-file-cannot-be-found?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Implement ammo-dependent turret art for TD Mobile SAM
data.body:
Another result of my work on TDX.

Mobile SAM (SSM in original game) now changes turret art depending on current amount of ammo. Uses `AmmoPool`.

Had to change the weapon's reload behavior to give this more limelight, so this might need some balance testing in addition to regular reviewing.

Closes #7493.

data.title: Replace map.Contains with proper array bounds checks.
data.body: This fixes a bunch of cases where map.Contains is used as a guard against index out of range exceptions.  These cases now use the Contains check on the CellLayer itself.

data.title: Use HeadshotDeath instead of BulletDeath for Umagon's rifle
data.body: "Follow-up" of #8742, see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8742#discussion_r34966625.

data.title: Introduce order queue + upper limit of orders per tick for players
data.body:
This works great for AI, so we should consider something similar for human players.

Obviously responsiveness is far more important for player-controlled units, so we'd have to set far more lenient limits (let's say 8 or 10 orders per tick), but even then we could turn massive single-tick lag spikes when huge armies are sent around into a couple of smaller spikes that don't almost halt the game for a second, only slow it down a little.
